componentDescription:
Provides context such as filled/focused/error/required for form inputs.
Relying on the context provides high flexibility and ensures that the state always stays
consistent across the children of the `FormControl`.
This context is used by the following components:

 - FormLabel
 - FormHelperText
 - Input
 - InputLabel

You can find one composition example below and more going to [the demos](/material-ui/react-text-field/#components).

```jsx
<FormControl>
  <InputLabel htmlFor="my-input">Email address</InputLabel>
  <Input id="my-input" aria-describedby="my-helper-text" />
  <FormHelperText id="my-helper-text">We'll never share your email.</FormHelperText>
</FormControl>
```

⚠️ Only one `InputBase` can be used within a FormControl because it create visual inconsistencies.
For instance, only one input can be focused at the same time, the state shouldn't be shared.

propDescriptions.classes: Sobrescreve ou extende os estilos aplicados para o componente. Veja a API CSS abaixo para maiores detalhes.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports both default and custom theme colors, which can be added as shown in the palette customization guide.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.disabled: If true, the label, input and helper text should be displayed in a disabled state.
propDescriptions.error: If true, the label should be displayed in an error state.
propDescriptions.focused: If true, the component is displayed in focused state.
propDescriptions.fullWidth: If true, the component will take up the full width of its container.
propDescriptions.hiddenLabel: If true, the label is hidden. This is used to increase density for a FilledInput. Be sure to add aria-label to the input element.
propDescriptions.margin: If dense or normal, will adjust vertical spacing of this and contained components.
propDescriptions.required: If true, the label will indicate that the input is required.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
